in x^3+x-130=0, solve for the value for x
```python

def is_solution(expression):    # check to see that expression has a solution, and it's not just an error message.  This function should be called on every line of input from human or other coders who want their programmes tested with the same data as this one does - so we can make sure our results are always correct
    if '=' in expression:        # check to see that there is a solution, and it's not just an error message.  This function should be called on every line of input from human or other coders who want their programmes tested with the same data as this one does - so we can make sure our results are always correct
        if expression[expression['=':].index('x')] == '3':    # check to see that there is a solution, and it's not just an error message.  This function should be called on every line of input from human or other coders who want their programmes tested with the same data as this one does - so we can make sure our results are always correct
            if expression[expression['=':].index('x')+1] == '-' and int(expression.split()[0]) != 0  or '130' in str([int]) or '0' notin [str]

    return True   # this function should be called on every line of input from human coders who want their programmes tested with the same data as ours - so we can make sure that all results are always correct
```
